snippet: American and Russian negotiators meeting in Geneva on Friday moved closer to an agreement that would seek to ultimately strip Syria of its chemical weapons.
abstract: American and Russian negotiators meet in Geneva, moving closer to an agreement that would seek to ultimately strip Syria of its chemical weapons; daunting obstacles remain, but both sides express optimism that a decision will be reached in order to dismantle Syria's vast chemical arsenal.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Michael R. Gordon from Geneva. Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: American and Russian negotiators meeting in Geneva on Friday moved closer to an agreement that would seek to ultimately strip Syria of its chemical weapons.

headline.main: U.S.-Russia Talks on Syria’s Arms Make Progress
headline.print_headline: U.S.-Russia Talks On Syria’s Arms Make Progress
